alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Henry; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 9:58PM EST until February 22 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Lockport Lock affecting Carroll, Henry and Owen Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Lockport Lock. * WHEN...From this evening to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Parts of Eagle Creek campground, between Worthville and Perry, flood along KY 355. At 33.0 feet, Low lying roads near the river along and west of KY 355 flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 28.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 32.4 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall to 31.3 feet Sunday evening. It will rise to 31.4 feet Monday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood stage is 33.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding is possible and rivers are forecast to exceed bankfull. If you are in the advisory area remain alert to possible flooding, or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued tomorrow morning.
